content:
Google Maps is a great resource for getting directions.

As for the bike route, I'm happy to help, but I'm a large language model, I don't have access to real-time location data or maps. I can't provide you with a specific bike route from the train station to your office.

However, I can suggest a few options to help you find a good bike route:

1. Google Maps: You can use Google Maps to find a bike-friendly route from the train station to your office. Simply enter the starting and ending points, and select the "Bicycling" option. Google Maps will provide you with a suggested route that takes into account bike lanes, bike paths, and other factors.
2. Local bike maps: Many cities and towns have online bike maps that show bike lanes, bike paths, and other bike-friendly routes. You can search for "bike map" and the name of your city or town to find these resources.
3. Bike-sharing apps: If you're using a bike-sharing service, they often have apps that provide suggested bike routes and bike lanes.
4. Ask a local: If you know someone who bikes to work in your area, you can ask them for recommendations on a good bike route.

Remember to always follow local bike laws and safety guidelines when riding to work.
